Key Arguments: Truth is subjective and can change over time as more evidence is gathered.
Freedom to discuss differing views encourages critical thinking and personal growth.
An official body cannot align with all individual perspectives in society.
Misinformation and disinformation are simply alternate truths that lack sufficient evidence for some.
Restricting discussion on important topics stifles necessary conversations and evidence gathering.
The bill is seen as authoritarian and contrary to Australian values of free expression.
Notable Quotes: A truth is an opinion considered to be undeniable based on overwhelming evidence or facts at a given point-in-time.
Having the freedom to discuss alternate and descending views encourages critical thinking and helps our own rationalisation of facts.
The introduction of this bill intends to stifle and penalize discussion on alternate views of truth for topics that impact personal safety, humanity or the environment.
Removing the ability for someone to express their views is authoritarian and un-Australian.
